Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angular shoulder. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle with a relief heart at the tip of the spine. Within the base-ring is an impressed Greek name.
Curator's comments: Copy of a Corinthian Vine-and-Ray lamp.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2070)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
